title: (18800) Baza - 31 Calle Antonio del Rey
description: I come from the city and have seen people sleep here, sometimes asleep, the truth is that it looks like a very quiet place, next to a park and close to the city center. I see it as a better option than up there where the market usually goes in a few pubs near the area and they can have back pain and this is usually a place where people are a bit odd. By the police, I do not want to worry, here in the city, that they are involved in nothing.

title: (18800) Baza - 12 Calle Proyecto F
description: Very quiet street parking. No traffic at night.

title: (18800) Baza - 15 Calle Proyecto F

title: (18800) Baza - Calle Bulevar Dama de Baza
title_short: (18800) Baza - Calle Bulevar Dama de Baza
description: Football field car park. Containers available, supermarkets nearby. The police passed without telling us anything, quiet night.

title: (18800) Baza - 20 Urbanización el Nogal
description: Day and night parking, covered parking, very quiet, with a lot of shade in a BP gas station we have spent two super quiet nights and during the day there is no problem since it has a lot of shade.

title: (18800) Baza - Calle Puente los Geas
description: Flat leafy overflow car park for nearby cemetery, but very rarely used. Access via one-way lane from Baza. Water at cemetery during opening hours. Line-of-sight to TV and phone transmitters. Nice quiet walk into Baza from here.

title: (18800) Baza - 311 A-4200
description: Place to sleep peacefully, trucks park

title: (18800) Baza - Pk 341 A-92N
description: 24h parking to rest

title: (18800) Baza -
description: There is no service of any kind. It is a space between fields easement paths. Very quiet both day and night. The town of Baza is not far away and there is everything there, even about 15 minutes away there is a service station with emptying and filling water. Next to the ship that is seen in the image there is also some space attached to the road

title: (18810) Caniles - 18 Calle Fuerte
description: Free motorhome area at the fairgrounds. with 6 very large squares slightly inclined and paved. Well, all of them are filled and emptied, both gray and black. bakery 100 meters. also playground 100 meters very quiet. You can't park the first week of August due to the fair.

title: (18810) Caniles - 28 Calle Fuerte
description: Wide plain very flat next to the institute the strong and the brotherhood Jesus crucified. Very quiet, although in the morning has the mess of the institute, from noon is very very quiet and very good area to spend a night without noise. Caniles is a town that maintains the charm of those before and is a good area to get into the Sierra de Baza Natural Park.

name: Cuevas Andalucia
title: (18800) Cuevas Andalucia
description:
Cuevas Andalucia is a sustainable and responsible tourism project located on an 8.5 hectare olive grove in the last desert in Europe. We have been renting eco-friendly cave houses since 2009 and have invested heavily in alternative energy. Today, our property has become an example for testing and taking advantage of new alternative energy technologies.
Many customers ask us to visit our facilities which have just obtained the maximum A+ energy certificate. Our philosophy is to demonstrate that another world and another way of consuming are possible while preserving the planet and in a concrete way.

In our isolated property, we have no neighbors and we favor the tranquility of our customers. We have created a few plots to accommodate digital nomads, vanlifers and adventurers who go around the world, 4x4 with roof tent, vans, motorhomes max. 7.5m, trucks. Swimming pool available in season from May to the end of September. High-quality Wi-Fi for working.
On your arrival, we will give you a roadbook in your language (Spanish, French, English or German) with dozens of unusual activities, each linked to Google Maps to guide you easily. If you have a smartphone, we can also download a GPS with audio guide that will show you our unusual routes in your language. Family atmosphere on the property. There is no emptying of the chemical toilets, but toilets are present.
Surprising region for its environment remained intact. Shops and supermarkets in the historic center of Baza 7 minutes from the property. Possibility to do laundry. Bivouac or isolated plots on the entire 9 hectare property in adventure mode with water and electricity if space is needed.

Property intended for customers who love tranquility. Parties are not allowed. Dogs are accepted if they do not make noise. Please call before arriving and only on this WhatsApp.

Property to try absolutely for its environment, its adventurous atmosphere and its tranquility. Wood available for campfires in winter. Ownership based on responsible tourism, we do not allow your motorhome to be washed as we live in one of the last deserts in Europe and water is precious. We also invite you to fill up your tanks at service stations. The water on the property is for the use of showers, toilets and for the kitchen area. Please take this into account. For motorhomes, keep in mind that the last 800 meters of the access road is on a track in good condition, it is the price to pay for peace of mind! Payment only in cash or by PayPal via a secure QR code.

We sell our olive oil, our jams and our almonds. All our products come from organic farming. Ask at reception. Good course. Dawn

address.street: Camino de Oria o de Baza, s/n

title: (18810) Caniles - 16 Calle a
description: Another area where you can park there spend the night in caniles. It is a polygon area, next to the municipal sports pavilion where there are quite apparent petanque courts that facilitate its location. It is not a particularly beautiful site, because it is a polygon area on the outskirts, but it is very quiet. We have spent a silent night, only disturbed in the morning starting at 8 am with hunter shots, because apparently hunting is common here among the neighbors.

title: (18811) Zújar - Unnamed Road
description: Quiet place to spend the night. Beautiful views There are no shadows

title: (18811) Zújar - 20A Calle Carretera
description: Large parking lot in a small town. There is shopping. There are also some trucks on the square, which leave early in the morning. There is a water point with drinking water 30 m away on the main road.

title: (18811) Zújar - 7 Camino de la Virgen
description: Public fountain, the water does not taste like chlorine.

title: (18800) Baza - Unnamed Road
description: Parking of the information center and restaurant

title: (18860) Baúl -
description: Old quarry near the Cortijo de Narváez and visitor center of the Sierra de Baza. From there you can go out and do several hiking routes, such as the climb to the Narváez viewpoint. With luck and patience you can see animals in the park. In the center they recommend going up to Prados del Rey.

title: (18800) Baza - N-342
description: In the Jazz Park, a few pitches for a quiet night. the park guards passed without questioning us. the deeper we go to the interpretation center, the more the forest atmosphere sets in.

title: (18811) Baños de Zújar -
description: Some wonderful views. An incredible peace. Slightly uneven ground

title: () Zújar - Unnamed Road
description:
Small sheltered spot on quiet lane. Great views of the lake. Near the natural hot sulphur springs and the Balenario Zújar (spa hotel). Close to a walking/mountainbiking route up Jabalcón mountain. Highly recommended: the mostly  flat 360° walking route round the mountain. Take a picnic and make a day of it. 

This place is only really big enough for one motorhome, but up to 4 vehicles travelling together could share it.

Access is from the east. The lane us narrow snd rough in places but it is surfaced all the way to the spot. The pointer on the map may not be in the exact spot as I thought I could add the details later but the app didn't keep the location. If you try to access from the west it is up a steep rocky track, so not recommended. Avoid very wet weather as the east access can be very muddy and rocky.

title: (18811) Baños de Zújar -
description: Beautiful sunset views, right next to the highway but with hardly any traffic. Quiet place right next to the closed restaurant of the spa. Easy access.

title: (18811) Baños de Zújar -
description: Nice spot for about 3 cars.  Beatiful view and near by hot spring pool. Steep acces

title: (18811) Zújar - Unnamed Road
description: Good place by the water. Not recommended for big motorhomes. You can see how to get here with satelite google maps. You can walk down first and see how the road looks like but it is worth the effort.

title: (18811) Baños de Zújar -
description:
We stood here for one night. You can walk down to the hot springs in 6 minutes and bathe there. Wonderfully warm!
The place is very dusty but quite flat and under trees. You have a beautiful view of the lake and a great sunset. Totally quiet and pitch dark at night. We loved it!

title: (18811) Baños de Zújar - Carr. de los Baños
title_short: (18811) Baños de Zújar - Carr. de los Baños
description: Parking for 2 cars. Far from the others. However, there is 4G here, which is not available at the hot springs further down.

name: Restaurante Los Baños | Zújar
title: (18811) Restaurante Los Baños | Zújar
description: Fantastic location, former restaurant with thermal water pool at 40°C. Free access. Far from tourists, far from the city with a beautiful view of the lake.

title: (18811) Zújar - Carretera de los Baños
description: Parking space between the trees with spectacular view. No problem large vehicles.

title: (18811) Baños de Zújar -
description:
This place is about 1km from the baths.
At 20m, below the road (which was practically without traffic during our stay).
It is a quiet place with a nice view. There is no shade or facilities. It's flat and a bit dusty.
Several motorhomes can park there.
For the "athletes" there is the possibility of walking down to the river but it is a bit steep.
4G works fine.
Access is good and easy (April 2023 with our 7m CC)

Restaurant and Baths “Los Baños”
(Approx. 1km) For our greatest pleasure: We bathed in the outdoor swimming pool with a part under a shelter (thermal water at 34 degrees and it costs 2.5€/pers.) there is a small cloakroom and we can use the toilets of the restaurant.
Then we ate the “menu del dia” which is very good value for money (24€ in total for two, starter, main course, dessert with a glass of wine, a bottle of water and a coffee). The staff is dedicated, friendly and efficient.
The facilities are simple and a bit dated but this is more than compensated by the sublime view of the delta and having the chance to be in this privileged place.
The restaurant and the swimming pool are open from March to November and (from approx.) 10 a.m. to 6.30 p.m. (kitchen until 3.30 p.m./4 p.m.)

natural swimming pool
From the parking lot of the “Los Baños” restaurant, you can go down a path to a natural swimming pool (free) and swim in water at 40 degrees (muddy)

title: (18813) Cuevas del Campo - Unnamed Road
description: Free public waterfront parking.

title: (18813) Cuevas del Campo - Unnamed Road
description: This area is for “naturalists”. Lots of different levels and areas for parking. We spent time down near the bank but bigger campers can drive easily to the top part. Very peaceful and both the water and land is clean. Bins nearby at entrance. Might be different atmosphere in summer?

title: (18800) Gor - Unnamed Road
description: Beautiful site, surrounded by nature and at 2000m, with a high mountain feeling. The access setting is quite good even after the visitor center. Without about 12 km from the highway, but it is worth it. Tranquility, mountain goats, scots pine forest and very beautiful routes that start from the same place as the car park.

title: (18812) Freila - Unnamed Road
description: Wonderful place with the most beautiful view I've had to sleep so far. There is a way to find several places to lie flat, the view is sublime, the lake is accessible for swimming and there is no noise.

title: (18812) Freila - Unnamed Road
description: A parking space without anything is only suitable for 4x4 vehicles and if the reservoir is not full, it is very quiet and great for swimming. A few meters away are hot springs where you can also swim and even for free.

title: (18817) Benamaurel - 18C Barrio Yeseras
description: Very nice place at the entrance of the city slightly high with a beautiful view of the valley. table and barbecue available. tap.

title: (18817) Benamaurel - 17D Barrio Yeseras
description: Site on the outskirts of the town, there are 2 esplanades, on the highest beautiful views of the town and landscape, we slept one night very well

title: (18800) Baza - s/n N-342
description: A parking next to the road and next to a small motel/ restaurant. Ok for a night

name: Camping Rural La Cabañuela **
title: (18812) Camping Rural La Cabañuela **
description: This large campsite is not far (about 5 km) from the small town of Freila, where there are some cafes, bars, a bank and a supermarket. From the square you can see the beautiful lake - Embalse del Nigratin - where you can swim, SUP and kayak. The small campsite has shaded areas and sanitary facilities in good condition. The pool is where you meet the locals who come here to swim. The staff are very friendly, helpful and competent and make the stay very special.

title: (18817) Benamaurel - 49 Calle Calderón de la Barca
title_short: (18817) Benamaurel - 49 Calle Calderón de la Barca
description: Ground parking, for the night, quiet and with little traffic

title: (18812) Freila - Unnamed Road
description: Continuing to the right of the small restaurant, there is a small stone path that leads to the lake with a turquoise water with a magnificent view of the mountains, absolute calm, the only one in the world at the end of May, advice: attention soil furniture and wholesale pebbles! I recommend that in the SUV (we had a lot of trouble out with a T5 !!! Because big climb and unstable ground we skated well)

title: (18812) Freila - Unnamed Road
description: Pantano de freila, is an outdoor area with a marsh and playground for games.

title: (18800) Baza - GR-8101
description: Flat gravel parking with nice view. Very quiet, not windy, in one side covered by rocks and old stone building.

title: (18850) Cúllar - A-92N
description: 2 showers

title: (18850) Cúllar - A-92N
description: Bp service station parking area open 24 hours a92 motorway, direction Granada. Parking on the side of Tesla electric terminals. Water and drain on the side.

title: (18870) - 55 Agregado Valdiquin

title_short: (18891) Venta del Peral - 99 Aldea Venta del Peral

title: (18812) Freila - Unnamed Road
description: Quiet parking space on a platform with access to the water. Quiet, clean and fantastic view. Clean up waste and toilet paper and keep it tidy. Otherwise this place will be closed in no time.

title: (18860) Bácor - 2 Calle Negratín
description: Water fountain and outdoor gym..

title: (04898) Alcontar - Unnamed Road
description: Small quiet place in pretty location. Good for walking/cycling and for the night sky. Two or three vehicles travelling together could fit.

title: (18813) Cuevas del Campo - Balcón del Negratín
title_short: (18813) Cuevas del Campo - Balcón del Negratín

Beautiful views and road to the left of the point of view that goes down to the reservoir but the return has a significant rise. It is possible to sleep. Something tilting but you can search for flat areas. Toilet currently closed.

title: (18813) Cuevas del Campo - 1 Calle Presa del Negratin
title_short: (18813) Cuevas del Campo - 1 Calle Presa del Negratin

title: (18813) Cuevas del Campo - 1 Calle Presa del Negratin
title_short: (18813) Cuevas del Campo - 1 Calle Presa del Negratin

title: (18813) Cuevas del Campo - 1 Vial Camino
description: Just off the road at the entrance to Club Náutico Negratin. Nothing here at all but a nice view of the reservoir.

title: (04899) El Ramil -
description: Flat terrain for parking right on the via verde. We spent the night here but it is not an official parking. The old railway line can be reached a few hundred meters south. Parking from the book cycling like a train.

title: (18813) Cuevas del Campo - Camino de Negretín
title_short: (18813) Cuevas del Campo - Camino de Negretín
description: A nice little corner for a midday meal, I'm there, and maybe for one night but not tested. No service.

title: (18850) Cúllar - 50 Avenida José Jiménez

title: (18850) Cúllar - 340 NE-35
description: Large free parking with free care and across the street a lovely swimming pool. Everything close to the A92.

title: (18870) Gor - 14 Calle Fuente
description: Great fresh drinking water. there is a small supermarket a couple blocks away and a couple restaurants. some streets are VERY narrow so take be careful. there should be access for everyone though if you avoid those streets so look at the map first.

title: (04897) Alcontar - 6D Calle Acequia
description: Beautiful place next to the Almazora River surrounded by large trees that create a very pleasant atmosphere, there are showers and services in the sports facilities next door that can be used freely and are also very clean, has a water outlet and light in sports facilities!

title: (18860) Guadix - Mirador del Llano de Olivares
title_short: (18860) Guadix - Mirador del Llano de Olivares
description: Parking near the two hundred Dolmens de Gorafe. An excellent site.

title: (18860) Guadix - Mirador del Llano de Olivares
title_short: (18860) Guadix - Mirador del Llano de Olivares
description: And just where we turned from the horrible path that was there we stopped. In the end we spent the night there and it was not bad at all. Nice sunset. Quiet place but sometimes 4x4 pass very fast on the road.

title: (18890) Gorafe -
description: Small parking bay for vans when the other spaces are occupied. beautiful view and with a clear sky, wonderful starry nights.

title: (18890) Gorafe - Camino de Bácor
description: Nature site with 360 degree panoramic view near the radio tower of Gorafe. Pure nature!! On the way there are many of the dolmens and the way to the thermal bath in Alicun is also very nice.

title: (18860) Olivar -
description: Beautiful place with a great view. Easily accessible for 4x4 with ground clearance (the driveway was dusty and dry for me - it can be a bit more difficult to reach when wet) - about 20 meters after the turning loop, relatively flat and good to stand for one night. Hardly any traffic and when it gets dark it is completely lonely. No service, but LTE reception. Attention, the terrain is partly very steep - danger of falling when walking at night, but a beautiful starry sky.

title: (18539) Villanueva de las Torres -
description: Bivouac at the Los Coloraos viewpoint in the Gorafe desert. Spectacular view and only night in the world

title: (18890) Gorafe - 1 Calle Alhambra
description: Gorafe caravan area. All the services.

title: (18890) Gorafe - 1 Calle la Mina
description: It has no services. visit the megalithic center, the dolmens and especially the viewpoint of the coloraos in the park of the quaternary. the nights are spectacular has hardly any light pollution.

title: (18890) Gorafe - n4 Plaza de la Constitución
title_short: (18890) Gorafe - n4 Plaza de la Constitución
description: Good, accessible water point, right on the village square.

title: (18890) Gorafe - 1B Calle Granada
description: Old washhouse with drinking water tap located just behind the big rosemary bush (small flow)

title: (18890) Gorafe -
description: Parking by the side of the road, very peaceful. Magnificent 360 view.

title: (18870) Gor - 9 Carretera A-92
description: Gas station and cafe restaurant. Good for a stopover or overnight stay. Open 24 hours a day. Quiet parking lot.

title: (18890) Gorafe - Unnamed Road
description: Desert of Gorafe, along the track. Stunning and calm view. Small promontory that allows to be sheltered from the morning sun. Access in T5.

title: (18890) Villanueva de las Torres - Camino de los Campos Mones
title_short: (18890) Villanueva de las Torres - Camino de los Campos Mones
description: Views in the nowhere close to Gorafe, where there are over 200 dolmens. Very quiet and lonely. Access for large vehicles not suitable. 4 x 4 with access from Gorafe/Guadix at least in bad weather advantage, Villanueva de las Torres sis imperative (particularly after rain dangerous). The route is scenic eunderschön!  No facilities.

title: (18890) Gorafe -
description: Please note that this site is reserved for aesthetes and perfectionists! Surely my most beautiful spot of the year. Spot set back from the main track which is otherwise very uncrowded. Go straight on the motorable track that starts from the megalite car park before Gorafe, in the direction of los Coloraos for 9km, small branch on the right, it's flat, no need for wedges.

title: () Villanueva de las Torres - Camino de los Campos Mones
title_short: () Villanueva de las Torres - Camino de los Campos Mones
description: Probably one of the most beautiful places to spend a night !!! Calm, seclusion, Nature in its raw state. Accessible by gravel path of about 12 km from the village of Villanueva de Las Torres. Vehicle therefore suitable (4x4, crossover or small vehicle with good traction on hills !!! Breathtaking view !!!

title: (18890) Gorafe - Unnamed Road
description: In the middle of nowhere in the middle of nowhere, absolute tranquility and silence, accessible with a motorhome with enhanced traction or 4x4, otherwise do not venture on the track, it is sometimes in poor condition, with steep slopes

title: (04890) Serón - 40 Diseminado Estacion Fc
description:
Parking area next to the Vía Verde del Hierro and The Planetarium/
Astronomical Observatory of Seròn a fabulous place for children and families. ESSENTIAL if Serön is visited.  Nearby there are toilets and a water outlet.

title: (23486) Fontanar -
description: Nice quiet secluded spot, easy access via gravel road

title: (18818) Los Olivos -
description: Parking in the middle of the Geopark of Granada hidden and without any type of service. Ideal to spend the night in privacy and surrounded by spectacular nature. It does not have easy access, hence the 4x4 parking.

title: (04899) Serón - 211 Poligono Industrial las Zaleas
description: Cepsa service station in a pretty tourist town nearby there is a parking lot with a grassy picnic area, plus the workers at the station are very nice.

title: (04899) Serón - 113 Poligono Industrial las Zaleas
description: Generous parking bays on both sides directly behind the small town of "Serón". Not a beautiful view, but total peace and quiet. The road is hardly used. Ideal for a safe and silent night.

title: (04899) Serón - 3 Calle Caliz
description: Barriada Los Zoilos (Serón) Parking next to the Vía Verde del Hierro, in Serón, 800m from the old station, converted into a restaurant, and from the Valle del Almanzora interpretation center, where there is also a small astronomical observatory and a planetarium that organizes various activities. The site is ideal to do the Greenway as it is halfway to the most beautiful part. It has containers for recycling, bins, a source of potable water for drinking and a playground. Nice views. Respecting the local people there should be no problem. Maximum 3 vehicles on battery. Not for more than 6'50 m because the trees are low (height limit 2'60 m) and you cannot hit back.

title: (04890) Serón - 19 AL-6404
description: Gravel roadside parking fairly quiet. At the moment there is no ban on staying overnight and I spent a very quiet night. It is not very big, but it can fit 5 or 6 motorhomes. It is at the entrance to the sports center and there is a river park. Pets are allowed but on a leash and there is a nice walk along the river. From here you can make trails and in the town (very nice to see too) there are some bars, we recommend "La Cochera". We were attended by 2 very friendly girls who, despite initially not having vegetarian options, got out of trouble very well. All very rich and good price. Very welcoming people.

title: (23486) Pozo Alcón - Unnamed Road
description: Location for a vehicle, calm and quiet night, very nice view. No services. Please keep it clean.

title: (04887) Lúcar - Unnamed Road
description: Idyllic place where we have spent one night and gone hiking. Lobera stone, natural monument.

title: (04887) Lúcar - Unnamed Road
description: Parking lot of the Area Recreativa Povedo, access from Balsa de Cela over gravel with 7 meter camper easily possible.

title: (04890) Serón - A-1178
description: La Jordana recreational area, barbecue area, picnic areas and water source (without sanitary control). Gravel level parking. The access is tarred.

title: (18890) Gorafe - GR-6100
description:
A level gravel bay, similar to the others along this road. This one is sheltered by rock on 3 sides. Perfect for when the wind is a bit too strong to be out in the open.
No paths or attractions, just a secluded quiet spot for the night.

title: (18890) Gorafe - GR-6100
description: Next to a quiet road, flat land that can accommodate 2 or 3 vehicles. Magnificent view. No service.

title: (04532) Escúllar - Unnamed Road
description: Super quiet place to spend the night or park for cycling routes. Access is very good

title: (18539) Villanueva de las Torres -
description: Small flat place next to a path 20m from the GR6100. We spent a beautiful night in a beautiful and peaceful environment

title: (18539) Villanueva de las Torres - 22-24 Calle Almazara
title_short: (18539) Villanueva de las Torres - 22-24 Calle Almazara
description: Esplanade in the center of the city. You can't park here or next to the sports field, but the streets are narrow. The city is beautiful.

title: () Pozo Alcón - 78 C/Atalayuela
description: Pozo Alcon Motorhome Parking located at the foot of the Sierra del Pozo in the Cazorla Natural Park. It is located in the town with all kinds of shops, services and leisure and sports activities

title: (23485) Pozo Alcón - A-326
description: Small car park next to a hermitage, a good place to visit the Enchanted Higueras Forest from here. It does not have any type of service, not even containers. More a place to go on the go than anything else.

title: (18850) Cúllar - Unnamed Road
description: Venta Quemada, rest stop with inn with local specialties, good cheap food, safe place and relatively quiet even for the night

title: (18539) Villanueva de las Torres - GR-6101
description: In the spa car park, ideal for visiting the petroglyphs, the dolmens, the Toril aqueduct, the megalithic interpretation center of Gorafe.

title: (18539) Villanueva de las Torres - GR-6101
description: Near the hot spring.

title: (04887) Tíjola - 2 Barrio Balsa de Cela
description: Very quiet place a few meters from a road with almost no traffic and about 300 meters from the Balsa de Cela, a natural pool of thermal waters to take a good bath. We have spent the night without any problem next to some ruins of a farmhouse and with views of Tíjola and the Sierra de Filabres, with the Bacares tetica in the background. I will repeat the overnight for sure.

title: (04887) Tíjola - 21 Calle Cela
description: In front of the "fuente de Cela", hot springs at 24 degrees

title: (23486) Fontanar -
description: A large plateau with a magnificent view of the Rio Guadiana Menor. Very flat and not very stony.

title: (04532) - AL-5405
description: A small pull-off by the side of the road. Absolutely amazing views of the Sierra Nevada. It's a very quiet spot. There are no services.

title: (18538) Dehesas de Guadix - 19 Calle 28 de Febrero
title_short: (18538) Dehesas de Guadix - 19 Calle 28 de Febrero
description: Parking above the village on a quiet street.

title: (04890) Serón - 6 Barrio los Menas
description: Parking in the area of old iron mines, old town restored. There is a children's playground and hiking trail initiation area. Next there is a campsite and a bar

name: Camping de Las Menas  Serón
title: (04890) Camping de Las Menas Serón
description: Camping Las Menas Serón. Clean, welcoming, quiet.In a superb decor.

title: (18538) Dehesas de Guadix - 67 Avenida Constitucion
description: It is the only place where I found parking in the village. It's a bit lonely but the city is calm.

title: (04887) Tíjola - 5 AL-6100
description: Area to park and spend the night next to the rehabilitated railway station of Tíjola and Vía Verde del Almanzora. There is a bar-restaurant located inside the old station building. There is a free marked motorhome service area 1 km away.

title: (04880) Tíjola - A-334
description: ZONE Tijola area of Al-Moroc.

title: (04880) Tíjola - 13 Calle Jorquera
description:
Municipal Parking Town Hall. Tijola.
Illuminated at night. Level. No services. With different garbage containers for recycling. Good option to park and visit the town.

title: (23486) Hinojares - 2B Carretera de Huesa
description: Slight asphalt slope Parque infaltil

title: (04549) Aulago -
description: Small picnic area with shade (depending on the time of day) at a small abandoned hut slightly off a very little-used road. We didn't stay the night, just took a short lunch break.

title: (18850) Cúllar - A-92N
description: Beautiful place with possibility of overnight, the owner of the restaurant let us spend the night, has showers and possibility to fill water and drain water, lovely owners and exceptional food. Many small villages close by with the charm of the Sierra de Granada

title: () Pozo Alcón - A-326
description: Parking next to the road that connects Pozoalcon and Huescar, over the Bolera reservoir Ideal place for hiking. A 5 min walk away is the restaurant of the recreational area of Bolera and Camping, which also has a restaurant.

title: () Pozo Alcón - A-326
description: Beautiful parking space in the Hoyo de los Pinos recreational area in the Sierra del Pozo. Cazorla natural park. Very close to the bowling alley ravine where canyoning is practiced and the bowling alley reservoir. With picnic area, water, barbecues, containers, games area and restaurant

title: (04889) Bacares - A-1178
description: Along the stone cistern down the road

name: Camping la Bolera
title: () Camping la Bolera
description: Camping sierra cazorla 2. Beautiful cool in summer and cold in winter with beautiful hiking trails place. Near the dam of the bowling alley. Many good restaurants nearby.

title: (18815) La Ermita - A-326
description: Large car park without prohibition. Very quiet even though the road is close. Very little traffic. Nice view of the lake and part of the dam. Trash on site.

title: () Pozo Alcón - A-326
description: Parking in the bowling alley restroom area. Very quiet place with picnic tables, water, garbage and restaurant

title: (18840) - 122 Diseminado Diseminados
description: simple quiet, flat parking, office services, little shade, no TV

title: (04550) Portocarrero - AL-4404
description: It is the only place where it is allowed to park and spend the night, the other places during the night, harm astronomical observation. In this place it is not disturbed and it is only requested that no lights be turned on outside. A great place to observe the stars, go hiking and in the months of September and October listen to the bellowing of the deer.

title: (04877) Somontín - Unnamed Road
description: A very beautiful place in the middle of nature. Total peace of mind. Easy to park and plenty of space. You have to go up from Purchena, Somontín and go up a narrow road with curves. It is an old quarry. For small motorhome / van

title: (23460) Peal de Becerro -
description: Point of view Quesada. Surrounded by nature. Tranquility and beautiful view.

title: (23486) Hinojares - A-6206
description: Under a big pine tree, shade assured just before the entrance of Sierra Cazorla which is closed From 9 pm to 9 am with ban of camping. 4x4 only steep access.

title: (04889) Gérgal - AL-4404
description: A good place to spend the night, with spectacular views and next to the Observatory, where you can also spend the night in the public parking

name: Camping El Angel (Granada)
title: (18816) Camping El Angel (Granada)
description: Small campsite well located next to the Castril Gazebo and at the beginning of the Castril trail. next to the population. Large pitches with electricity and water, vegetation. Open in winter. 21 euros AC, 2 people and electricity

title: (18840) Galera - 2 Plaza Mayor
description: Parking to spend the night in the center of town. Quiet and spacious. Very well located. With free WIFI of the city hall. Near museum. It is essential to visit sites. We will return without a doubt.

title: (18500) Guadix - Camino Cueva del Monje
description: Snowy slopes to the southwest, parking space for a van. clear pine forest CSome pines are dry and full of small twigs: FIRE HAZARD!!! Occasional runners or mountain bikers. Access: from the southwest only for crazy people without 4x4, easy access from the north. The height of the van is to park in the shade under the pine trees. Please keep clean!

title: (18816) Castril - 19 Calle Nueva del Rio
description: Parking by the river, 100 m from the village, swimming pool and access to the ski slopes

title: (04889) Gérgal - AL-4404
description: Flat area with a view of the Hochkalar side. Calm. No services, very uneven surfaces, full of slate rubble. Access 15km partly very steep and narrow !!

title: (18816) Castril - 4 Calle Fuente del Piojo
description: Public parking. Very quiet, 5 minutes from the center of Castril and 5 minutes from the walkways of the Castril river. The overnight was perfect.

title: (18816) Castril -
description: Parking in the lower area of Castril. There is another car park next to the dogs, a little further away. You go down a steep slope that is preferable to take living from the dam. The route of the Cerrada del río Castril is highly recommended. For a guided tour of the Castle it is necessary to call and book.

title: (18816) Castril - 19 Avenida del Portillo
description: Quiet and with good views

title: (18840) Galera - 21 Urbanizacion Suelo Urb S-2
description: Public parking day and night, without services, perfect for visiting Galera due to its location and tranquility. Overnight stays are allowed, and we feel safe at all times. Galera is a town with a wonderful history, with two sites and a magnificent archaeological museum.

title: (23486) Hinojares - Unnamed Road
description: Bivouac for two or 3 × 4, calm just before the park of La Sierra Cazorla, which is prohibited at the bivouac, entry from 9h to 21h.

title: (18816) Castril - A-326
description: Very nice parking and with good views. I do not know if you can stay overnight. We stopped for food and great views and very quiet. This road has almost no traffic, and although it indicates that it is prohibited, it is the traffic that everyone uses without problem. There is no shade or any type of service, from here you can walk to the reservoir, which is spectacular. By passing the tank, there is another similar parking area, with very good views and identical characteristics.

title: (18816) Castril - A-326
description: Above the dam there is a car park at the foot of the reservoir. It is also at the foot of the road, but there is not too much traffic. It says that it cannot be circulated, although the townspeople themselves tell you that yes, that the sign is old. In the parking lot at the foot of the river, those at the campsite call your attention to spend the night and threaten to call the police, but it seems not here. No services or shade. The tunnel that is a little ahead is quite familiar.

title: (18840) Galera - 15 Calle Rio Orce
description: Parking necropolis Tutugi, next to Galera. There is a bit of shade depending on the parking space and the time. Without any service, but quiet to spend the night. Ideal to visit the necropolis.

name: Área de autocaravanas de Abla-Montagón
title: (04510) Área de autocaravanas de Abla-Montagón
description: Area in ABLA (MONTAGÓN). Municipal land located about 2 km. from the city of Abla in Montagón Park. Maximum stay of 48 hours.

title: (04878) Suflí -
description: Suflí viewpoint. You can visit the town and buy the traditional fritadilla made with roasted tomatoes and peppers. Then park at the gazebo and enjoy the views and the silence. The wind may bother you and you may hear noise from nearby antennas, but nothing bothersome. Partridges are heard much more

title: (18500) Guadix - 14 Poligono Ue 5. 8
description: Parking area around the sugar bowl. it is an area with street infrastructure but not urbanized. A very quiet and alternative to the motorhome area, from which you can enjoy magnificent views of both Guadix and Sierra Nevada and where you can spend the night without problem. also from here there are several pretty hiking trails crossing the train track that is above on the right.

title: (18512) Huéneja - A-92
description: Service station with very clean toilets where it is possible to fill up your water tank for free. Please refuel at the same time!

title: (18858) Orce - 1 Calle Carlos Cano
description: Free public motorhome area created by the municipality of Orce. The village has a church and a castle. At 6 km is the interpretation center of the first settlers of Europe and the museum of prehistory. There are several nearby sites and a natural pool equipped.

title: (04500) Fiñana - Unnamed Road
description: Esplanade just behind the sawmill at the foot of the Sierra Nevada. Ideal to rest one night and continue the trip the next day, since it is quite close to the highway (you cannot hear it). Pretty level. With mobile and TV coverage. Nice views. Very quiet area even if you go with dogs. No shade during the day and no bins. To get there it is a dirt road but short and easy. A few meters away are the sports facilities of the town of Fiñana (swimming pool in summer). Let's respect these sites!

title: (18512) Dólar - A-92
description: Next to the restaurant, open 24 hours a day, open water, ideal for exploring the Marquesado de Zenete.

title: (04878) Suflí - 21 AL-8412
description: Municipal swimming pool parking. Out of season it is empty. Next to the town, quiet and safe. There are also two sites on the other side of the river, next to the paddle tennis court. Nearby is a picnic area with barbecues and water from which the Las Yeseras trail starts. You can visit the typical fritadilla factory. In the bar at the entrance of the town you eat very well

title: (04500) Fiñana -
description: Spot after 1km500 on a flat forest track, alone in the world, quiet night. We heard only one car passing in the morning.

title: (04879) Urrácal - 37 Calle Real
description: Public car park. Much space. The ascent by narrow street -Cañabates- direction "Urbanización Caparrós" but without problem. Super quiet place. super friendly population. I recommend Bar La Plaza. Hiking trails.

title: (18858) Orce - GR-9104
description: I think at a certain time of the year there must be a flock there. But in this period there is nothing. It is necessary to go up by a small dirt road but which is quite practicable (we went there without hindrance with our camper of 7x3m). There is a breathtaking view, everything is wild, 1km from Orce. There is a free area to fill the water and empty the bowls.

title: (18858) Orce - 1 Calle Chorreador
description:
Parking at the entrance of the village next to the Restaurant la Mimbrera. Ask for Luis Fernando. Just by having something in your restaurant or in your cafeteria you are allowed to park in a fenced area by the river.
Quiet village with Castle, Church, Paleontological Museum.
You can eat an exquisite lamb.
Good place to spend a few days and stroll through its streets full of history.

title: () Bacares - AL-4404
description: Very close to the other location listed but it was covered in snow. Very quiet and beautiful unobstructed view.

title: (04500) Fiñana - Unnamed Road
description: Stopped here for lunch. Idyllic spot with lovely view.m. We parked our motor home  to the left before passing the bridge. Enough space to turn around there. Follow the paved road over the bridge and pass the cottages to find yourself on a nice hiking route. Not sure where it leads, but has the yellow/white stripes hiking route marking. Totally worth it to venture into the forest from here or stay the night and add a hiking adventure followed by a jump in the water reserve. Enjoy!

title: (04889) Bacares - 16 Calle San Marcos
description: Plot of land in the upper part of Bacares, a good location for visiting the town or hiking in the area, especially during the almond blossom season. The plot does not have any services except those that the town itself has. Access by a small ramp, we have no problem with a 6m. We stayed 2 nights and no problem.

title: (18859) Cúllar - A-92N
description: Shell Station. Large empty parking lot .... Happy to find this place because coming from Alicante, many "via servicio" are in fact only braces leading simply in a village .... after 2 or 3 kms! Background of the isolated car park of the highway. Good for a night stop.

title: (04550) Portocarrero - A-1178
description: "La Merendera" recreational area, with direct spring water pipe. The facilities with many wooden tables (picnic area), sports court, barbecues (prohibited from 06/01 to 10/15) risk forest fires. Adapted for the disabled, access ramps from the lower parking. Level. Incredible views. There are no garbage containers. PLEASE KEEP THE AREA CLEAN. Hunting activity all year round. In winter possibility of closed access to the port due to snowfall, use of chains. Altitude 1900m. Close to Calar Alto Astronomical Observatory. Site without light pollution, exquisite to see starry sky. Coverage 2 of 5.

title: (04510) Abla - A-92A
description: ABLA area.- The place is located in an area adjacent to the station, just at the west entrance, about 500 m. The city center and right next to the Roman mausoleum. Maximum stay 48 hours. Distribute items are not allowed (chairs, tables, barbecue etc.). Services and shops in the city.

title: (04878) Sierro - 6D Calle Padre Pepe
description: Ideal place to spend the night and be able to visit the town. We have slept a couple of very peaceful nights. From the same town there are several beautiful trails.

title: (18858) Orce - 26 Camino San Simon
description: Parking in front of the first settlers museum in Europe

title: (18500) Guadix - 24 Avenida Buenos Aires
description: There are reserved parking spaces for mobile homes in front of the fairground directly on the street. There is a supply and disposal. FRESH WATER RIGHT, TOILET LEFT for rinsing. Toilet disposal ONLY in the lid at the bottom. There is a market on the fairground on Saturday. There is a flea market there on Sunday. The pitch is very close to the Cathedral, supermarkets, bars and restaurants.

title: (18500) Guadix - 16 Calle Arquitecto Lorenzo Rodríguez
description: Laundry room also open on Sundays with a dryer Parking in front of the street or in the supermarket car park 100m away. Payment only in coins. Wireless

title: (23485) El Almicerán -
description: Beautiful place on the shores of the Bolera reservoir surrounded by nature. Very quiet place to spend the day and night, we were alone. In the morning we were visited by two small fallow deer. Access track a bit complicated because it is rocky and has a steep slope in some sections.

title: (18858) Orce -
description: Nice picnic spot on the edge of a forest. The road to it is a reasonable gravel road of 8.8 km from the GR-9104. Completely abandoned. Great to stay overnight

title: (18500) Guadix - 2 Calle José Gibert Clols
description:
A gym with swimming pool and sauna. Possibility to use showers. All these included and 5€ per person. 

open 7.00 - 22.00,  Saturday 8-20,  Sunday 8-15, holidays 9-15.00

There is a cafe next to the place.

You can find parking on the stree or near by.

Friendly admin,  knows a little bit english.

title: (23485) El Almicerán -
description: Nice parking lot in the woods at the start of the walk

title: (18512) Huéneja -
description: Parking de la piscine municipale, à l'écart du village. pas de réglementation affichée. calme.

title: () Abla -
description: Next to the Abla cemetery, on a roadside with room for approx 3 vans. Good views of the town of Abla, Sierra Nevada and Sierra de los Filabres. Narrow inlet for A/C and GV

title: (18500) Guadix - 27 Avenida Mariana Pineda
description: The whole Ave. Mariana Pieneda has ample parking, mostly on both sides and the signs allow free parking for vehicles up to 5,5 tons.

title: (18500) Guadix - 94 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Parking next to the quiet hospital no prohibition spend a night without problems next to the center.

title: (23489) Quesada - Calle Cueva del Agua
description: Flat, unpaved esplanade, less than a km from Belerda.

title: (18500) Guadix - 57 Avenida Mariana Pineda
description: Gladis laundromat close to ALDI, DÍA and Lidl

title: (04520) Abrucena - 5 Camino Acequia Nueva
description: Small car park next to the tourist office. Maximum 6 motorhomes. Very quiet at night. Nice town with hiking trails through the Alpujarra of Almeria

title: (18500) Guadix - 9 Calle Ciudadana Hortensia
description: Suitable water point with two sampling points. Locals fill their drinking water here.

title: (04520) Abrucena - 11 Diseminado Abrucena
description: We spent a very quiet night in this place. The town is beautiful and very welcoming.

title: (18816) Castril - Camino de Castril a Santiago de la Espada
title_short: (18816) Castril - Camino de Castril a Santiago de la Espada
description: We spent the night in this viewpoint from December 31 to January 1. It does not have any services but it is super quiet and has a spectacular starry sky. Next to a dirt lane with little passage that day. We had no problem staying overnight

address.street: Camino de Castril a Santiago de la Espada

title: (18500) Guadix - 3 Poligono Ius 1
description: Day and night parking. Near the Hotel Abades and Burger King.

title: (18500) Guadix - nº5 Calle José Luis de Los Reyes Arenas
title_short: (18500) Guadix - nº5 Calle José Luis de Los Reyes Arenas
description: PS: we are individuals and they took the business from us without questioning :) ———— Lavandería y Empresa de Inserción “LADIS” - Industrial pressing (of insertion) which is also suitable for individuals. Very cost effective for large quantities of laundry. Easy to park in the area and we are 5 minutes from the cuevas district (troglodyte houses). The only other option in town is another laundromat (always shielded, small machines and hard to park, so that's it!). And they're nice too. We forgot to take a picture but the address is very easily found on Map!

address.street: nº5 Calle José Luis de Los Reyes Arenas

title: (18500) Guadix - 94 Calle Virgen de Fátima
description: Small car park, large spaces, convenient for walking and reaching the viewpoint overlooking Guadix and its cave houses. Magnificent. I don't know if we can stay overnight there, no prohibition signs but we just spend the afternoon here.

title: (18500) Guadix - 5 Calle Rosa Martínez Vera
description: Very quiet street side, far from the noise of the area near the cathedral. start hike "mirador fin del mundo"

title: (18858) Orce - Unnamed Road
description: For those who appreciate spending a night lost in the middle of nowhere

title: (18500) Guadix - 6D Urbanizacion Suelo Urb PP3
description: Very quiet esplanade where there is no prohibition sign of any kind, Guadix to Paulenca road, in front of the cemetery, where you can use the toilets when it is open. nearby there are bars, greengrocers and from there you can start the hiking route to the viewpoint of the End of the World, and on the way to Santiago, it is also close to the troglodyte neighborhood.

title: (04530) Ocaña - 2 Calle Libertad
description: Water point, next door there are tables, a barbecue area and a playground. Garbage cans are on the other side of the street.

title: (18500) Guadix - 98 Plaza Del Padre Poveda
description: Parking near the caves museum. Free with no signs. Marked bays. Near a look out point for 360 degree views of the caves.

title: (04520) Abrucena - 112 Calle Tarrasa
description: Village fountain and trash cans

title: (18512) Dólar - 12 Calle Henchidero
description: Quiet and flat site, 2 minutes from the town hall

title: (23489) Tíscar - 7 Tiscar
description: Nice parking place above Cueva del Agua (nice to visit). Below big official parking place, there are unpaved paths under the trees.

title: (18512) Dólar - 7 Calle Escuelas
description: Quiet place with sports facilities, playgrounds. ideal for hiking along the northern side of Sierra Nevada. the night is a bit lonely, but it's a city where there are no problems.

title: (23489) Tíscar - 7 Tiscar
description: Parking in the town leveled with land, in the morning the sun does not hit anything for a calmer sunrise

title: (18500) Guadix - 25 Camino de Lugros
description: Area in the family equestrian center. Excellent family welcome and environment. Very calm. You can take riding lessons. Possibilities of excursions and excursions on horseback, in a carriage, or in 4x4. Visits to the city, cellars and impressive viewpoints The gate is closed but not locked, it's up to you to open and close so that the horses don't go away.

title: (23489) Tíscar - 7 Tiscar
description: Parking for visitors of Sanctuarium of Tiscar. No services, no shade. It is wrtten there that it is private parking of Tiscar Village not sure if it is ok to spend the night.

title: (04870) Purchena - 3 Calle San Gines
description: Quiet area to park and see the quiet town, the natural water source of San Ginés

title: (04870) Sierro - Unnamed Road
description: Super quiet picnic area with spectacular views. you can spend the night quietly. it's in good condition.

title: (23489) Quesada - 21 Tiscar
description: Perfect place to sleep near the Cueva del Agua. It is paved and quite level and has a source with super clean water from the river. The only bad thing is that there are quite a few mosquitoes.

title: () Purullena - Unnamed Road
description: Great place .. very quiet and very shady. Have spent a very quiet night here. An old recreational area full of esplanades to put the caravan in the shade of pines. I see only two problems: the noise of the motorway is heard in the distance and there is an esplanade that is very dirty.

title: (18500) Purullena -
description: On the other side of the other spot. We hear less the highway suddenly, under the pines, quiet!

title: () Purullena -
description: Lieu très calme à l’ombre des pins, nombreuses places disponibles entre les arbres. Accès par un chemin. Conseiller pour les vans.!

title: (18816) Castril - Camino de Castril a Santiago de la Espada
title_short: (18816) Castril - Camino de Castril a Santiago de la Espada
description: Place enabled as a picnic area and with wheelchair accessibility. Next to the river. We were parked by day but I don't think there is a problem at night. There are 2 portable toilets and garbage can. The river is next.

address.street: Camino de Castril a Santiago de la Espada
